intro: Styphelia cymbiformis, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late winter to early spring. Styphelia cymbiformis thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist environment to flourish. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
